results.title: Tit for tat [Censored version]
results.creator_credit: Graeme Isaac, Mayfan and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Examines the world of tattoos and the surrounding culture of bikers and rebels as the filmmaker travels with Baldy, a biker and photo-journalist, to the Sandhurst Rally for the yearly Tattoo Exhibition and judging. There they meet AJ, the most tattooed man in Australia and a renowned tattoo artist himself. WARNING - SOME SCENES IN THIS PROGRAMME MAY OFFEND SOME VIEWERS.

results.title: Tiny world
results.creator_credit: Keith Merrill and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: The story of miniaturisation and how far it has advanced in the United States. Miniaturisation’s tremendous impact is shown in various activities - the space program, television, medicine and other fields - and specific applications in the watch, hand-held calculators, seat belts, stereo, police communications and the ATS-6 satellite.

results.title: Seeds of a new life
results.creator_credit: Nigel Evans, Richard Mordaunt, John Bloomfield and Randel Evans Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the work of Dorothy Heathcote, lecturer in drama, and a group of her students with the mentally handicapped children and adults at Earls House Hospital. Dorothy Heathcote discusses and demonstrates her methods and the patients participate in a variety of developmental acting and thinking activities.

results.title: Seed dispersal. - 3rd ed.
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents a visual report on different types of seedcoats and shows how external agents such as man,the wind, animals and birds help each kind become dispersed. Depending on which season it is, this will influence the dispersal of each type of seed.

results.title: Secretary
results.creator_credit: Steven Shainberg, Amy Hobby, Andrew Fierberg, Double A Films and Lions Gate Films
results.brief_description: A secretarial role at a law firm is a first job for a young girl with expert typing skills and having just left a hostel for people with mental illness, the girl also has a troubled home life and a history of self-mutilation. A look at contemporary sexual politics where ‘coming out’ has new meaning. The secretary, Lee Holloway (Maggie Gyllenhaal), reveals to her family and friends the need for her masochistic relationship with her boss E. Edward Grey (James Spader) and their special kind of love. The kind of office politics this film contains would horrify any Human Resources department! Based on the story “Secretary” by Mary Gaitskill. Cast includes Jeremy Davies. Contains Sex Scenes.

results.title: Secret world: around the bay
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Life Australia”.
There is life in Port Phillip Bay. Fascinating close-up photography demonstrates sea-creatures breathing, eating, propelling themselves and watching each other. Also shows some of the techniques of underwater exploration and some of the laboratory techniques of observing and classifying newly discovered life-forms.

results.title: Seduction: the cruel woman
results.brief_description: This video is based on two classic s/m novels; “Venus in Furs”, and “The Story of O”. “Venus in Furs” portrays the insatiable desire of one man to submit to one very cruel woman - indeed his love-ridden slavishness is so demanding that it takes a considerable toll on her. This is one sub-plot of this video. Wanda is the cruel woman, and through the course of the video, all Wanda’s primary relationships change, and yet the show, the performance art of sado-masochism, goes on. English subtitles.

results.title: Secret women's business
results.brief_description: We hide behind clothes. We hide behind hair. We hide behind jewellery. And all of a sudden none of that’s there… A warm documentary about women’s experience of their bodies in a Korean Bathhouse at Sydney’s Kings Cross. Snippets of voices slide over lush cinematography as the corporeal and the emotional melt in this bathing experience.

results.title: Secret wedding
results.creator_credit: Alejandro Agresti, Cinephile, Cogurccio and Allarts
results.brief_description: Fermin (Tito Haas) is found in the streets of Buenos Aires, with no recollection of his past, 15 years after he had disappeared and was presumed dead. He returns to the village where he had left behind Tota (Mirtha Busnelli) the woman he promised to wed, but since his arrest by the Junta, she has become so absorbed in his memory that she doesn’t recognise him. As he attempts to resume his life, the conservative power structures in the town (the church and the military) find his presence threatening as they discover his true identity.
